name: Pickthall
text: Ya Sin.

name: Pickthall
text: By the wise Qur'an,

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! thou art of those sent

name: Pickthall
text: On a straight path,

name: Pickthall
text: A revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful,

name: Pickthall
text: That thou mayst warn a folk whose fathers were not warned, so they are heedless.

name: Pickthall
text: Already hath the judgment, (for their infidelity) proved true of most of them, for they believe not.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We have put on their necks carcans reaching unto the chins, so that they are made stiff-necked.

name: Pickthall
text: And We have set a bar before them and a bar behind them, and (thus) have covered them so that they see not.

name: Pickthall
text: Whether thou warn them or thou warn them not, it is alike for them, for they believe not.

name: Pickthall
text: Thou warnest only him who followeth the Reminder and feareth the Beneficent in secret. To him bear tidings of forgiveness and a rich reward.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We it is Who bring the dead to life. We record that which they send before (them, and their footprints. And all things We have kept in a clear Register.

name: Pickthall
text: Coin for them a similitude: The people of the city when those sent (from Allah) came unto them;

name: Pickthall
text: When We sent unto them twain, and they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they said: Lo! we have been sent unto you.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Ye are but mortals like unto us. The Beneficent hath naught revealed. Ye do but lie!

name: Pickthall
text: They answered: Our Lord knoweth that we are indeed sent unto you,

name: Pickthall
text: And our duty is but plain conveyance (of the message).

name: Pickthall
text: (The people of the city) said: We augur ill of you. If ye desist not, we shall surely stone you, and grievous torture will befall you at our hands.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Your evil augury be with you! Is it because ye are reminded (of the truth)? Nay, but ye are froward folk!

name: Pickthall
text: And there came from the uttermost part of the city a man running. He cried: O my people! Follow those who have been sent!

name: Pickthall
text: Follow those who ask of you no fee, and who are rightly guided.

name: Pickthall
text: For what cause should I not serve Him Who hath created me, and unto Whom ye will be brought back?

name: Pickthall
text: Shall I take (other) gods in place of Him when, if the Beneficent should wish me any harm, their intercession will avail me naught, nor can they save?

name: Pickthall
text: Then truly I should be in error manifest.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! I have believed in your Lord, so hear me!

name: Pickthall
text: It was said (unto him): Enter paradise. He said: Would that my people knew

name: Pickthall
text: With what (munificence) my Lord hath pardoned me and made me of the honoured ones!

name: Pickthall
text: We sent not down against his people after him a host from heaven, nor do We ever send.

name: Pickthall
text: It was but one Shout, and lo! they were extinct.

name: Pickthall
text: Ah, the anguish for the bondmen! Never came there unto them a messenger but they did mock him!

name: Pickthall
text: Have they not seen how many generations We destroyed before them, which indeed returned not unto them;

name: Pickthall
text: But all, without exception, will be brought before Us.

name: Pickthall
text: A token unto them is the dead earth. We revive it, and We bring forth from it grain so that they eat thereof;

name: Pickthall
text: And We have placed therein gardens of the date-palm and grapes, and We have caused springs of water to gush forth therein,

name: Pickthall
text: That they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hands made it not. Will they not, then, give thanks?

name: Pickthall
text: Glory be to Him Who created all the sexual pairs, of that which the earth groweth, and of themselves, and of that which they know not!

name: Pickthall
text: A token unto them is night. We strip it of the day, and lo! they are in darkness.

name: Pickthall
text: And the sun runneth on unto a resting-place for him. That is the measuring of the Mighty, the Wise.

name: Pickthall
text: And for the moon We have appointed mansions till she return like an old shrivelled palm-leaf.

name: Pickthall
text: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor doth the night outstrip the day. They float each in an orbit.

name: Pickthall
text: And a token unto them is that We bear their offspring in the laden ship,

name: Pickthall
text: And have created for them of the like thereof whereon they ride.

name: Pickthall
text: And if We will, We drown them, and there is no help for them, neither can they be saved;

name: Pickthall
text: Unless by mercy from Us and as comfort for a while.

name: Pickthall
text: When it is said unto them: Beware of that which is before you and that which is behind you, that haply ye may find mercy (they are heedless).

name: Pickthall
text: Never came a token of the tokens of their Lord to them, but they did turn away from it!

name: Pickthall
text: And when it is said unto them: Spend of that wherewith Allah hath provided you, those who disbelieve say unto those who believe: Shall we feed those whom Allah, if He willed, would feed? Ye are in naught else than error manifest.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: When will this promise be fulfilled, if ye are truthful?

name: Pickthall
text: They await but one Shout, which will surprise them while they are disputing.

name: Pickthall
text: Then they cannot make bequest, nor can they return to their own folk.

name: Pickthall
text: And the trumpet is blown and lo! from the graves they hie unto their Lord,

name: Pickthall
text: Crying: Woe upon us! Who hath raised us from our place of sleep? This is that which the Beneficent did promise, and the messengers spoke truth.

name: Pickthall
text: It is but one Shout, and behold them brought together before Us!

name: Pickthall
text: This day no soul is wronged in aught; nor are ye requited aught save what ye used to do.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! those who merit paradise this day are happily employed,

name: Pickthall
text: They and their wives, in pleasant shade, on thrones reclining;

name: Pickthall
text: Theirs the fruit (of their good deeds) and theirs (all) that they ask;

name: Pickthall
text: The word from a Merciful Lord (for them) is: Peace!

name: Pickthall
text: But avaunt ye, O ye guilty, this day!

name: Pickthall
text: Did I not charge you, O ye sons of Adam, that ye worship not the devil - Lo! he is your open foe! -

name: Pickthall
text: But that ye worship Me? That was the right path.

name: Pickthall
text: Yet he hath led astray of you a great multitude. Had ye then no sense?

name: Pickthall
text: This is hell which ye were promised (if ye followed him).

name: Pickthall
text: Burn therein this day for that ye disbelieved.

name: Pickthall
text: This day We seal up their mouths, and their hands speak out to Us and their feet bear witness as to what they used to earn.

name: Pickthall
text: And had We willed, We verily could have quenched their eyesight so that they should struggle for the way. Then how could they have seen?

name: Pickthall
text: And had We willed, We verily could have fixed them in their place, making them powerless to go forward or turn back.

name: Pickthall
text: He whom we bring unto old age, We reverse him in creation (making him go back to weakness after strength). Have ye then no sense?

name: Pickthall
text: And We have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it meet for him. This is naught else than a Reminder and a Lecture making plain,

name: Pickthall
text: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.

name: Pickthall
text: Have they not seen how We have created for them of Our handiwork the cattle, so that they are their owners,

name: Pickthall
text: And have subdued them unto them, so that some of them they have for riding, some for food?

name: Pickthall
text: Benefits and (divers) drinks have they from them. Will they not then give thanks?

name: Pickthall
text: And they have taken (other) gods beside Allah, in order that they may be helped.

name: Pickthall
text: It is not in their power to help them; but they (the worshippers) are unto them a host in arms.

name: Pickthall
text: So let not their speech grieve thee (O Muhammad). Lo! We know what they conceal and what proclaim.

name: Pickthall
text: Hath not man seen that We have created him from a drop of seed? Yet lo! he is an open opponent.

name: Pickthall
text: And he hath coined for Us a similitude, and hath forgotten the fact of his creation, saying: Who will revive these bones when they have rotted away?

name: Pickthall
text: Say: He will revive them Who produced them at the first, for He is Knower of every creation,

name: Pickthall
text: Who hath appointed for you fire from the green tree, and behold! ye kindle from it.

name: Pickthall
text: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the like of them? Aye, that He is! for He is the All-Wise Creator,

name: Pickthall
text: But His command, when He intendeth a thing, is only that He saith unto it: Be! and it is.

name: Pickthall
text: Therefor Glory be to Him in Whose hand is the dominion over all things! Unto Him ye will be brought back.
